data.title: Medieval Bristol
data.text:
IMAGES OF MEDIEVAL ART AND ARCHITECTURE

BRITAIN: ENGLAND

BRISTOL (CATHEDRAL CHURCH OF THE HOLY AND UNDIVIDED TRINITY -

formerly ABBEY CHURCH OF ST. AUGUSTINE)

EXTERIOR

© Alison Stones

Plan- Adapted from Massé

Screen Sized Image DIMENSIONS (from Massé, p 107)

Total Length, external - 300 ft

Total Length, Internal 284 ft.

Length of Nave 125 feet

Width, including aisles 69 ft.

Length of transept 115 feet

Width of transept 29 feet

Height to vault in nave 52 ft.

Height to vault in Choir 50 feet

Area 22,556 square ft.

Preliminary Bibliography

Burroughs, Edward Arthur, Bristol Cathedral; its history, architecture, associations and mission.Bristol, Published for the Cathedral Renovation Fund by Partridge & Love, 1924. L.C.Number: NA971.B86 B9

Gomme,Andor, Michael Jenner, Bryan Little. Bristol, an architectural history . London : Lund Humphries, 1979.

LC Number NA971.B86 G6

Harrison, D. E. W. Bristol Cathedral : the Cathedral Church of the Holy and Undivided Trinity. [London : Pitkin Pictorials, c1975] LC Number: DA690.B8 H37

Massé, H.J.L.J.. Cathedral church of Bristol; a description of its fabric and a brief history of the episcopal see. London, G. Bell & sons, 1910. LC Number: NA971.B86 M4

Pevsner, Nikolaus. North Somerset and Bristol.[Harmondsworth, Eng.] Penguin Books [1958}LC Number: NA969.S69 P5n
